nom.tam.image.comp

Class Quantizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nom.tam.image.comp.Quantizer

  • public class Quantizer
extends Object
    This class takes a tile from a real image and converts it into integers which may then be compressed.
    Author:
    tmcglynn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Quantizer(double scale, double offset)
      Create a quantizer that will transform data to/from integer values using the algorithm: i = round(r*scale-offset + rand - 0.5) where the rand term represents a standard dither.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fill(byte[] tileData, Object data, TileDescriptor td)
      Restore a tile of the original data using the input byte array as input.
      byte[] quantize(Object input, TileDescriptor td, int tileIndex)
      This method is called for each tile to output the data for that tile.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quantizer

        public Quantizer(double scale,
         double offset)
        Create a quantizer that will transform data to/from integer values using the algorithm: i = round(r*scale-offset + rand - 0.5) where the rand term represents a standard dither.

    • Method Detail

      • quantize

        public byte[] quantize(Object input,
              TileDescriptor td,
              int tileIndex)
        This method is called for each tile to output the data for that tile. A byte array representing the output integer data is returned. This method calls recurseOut to descend to the low level primitive arrays and which in turn calls process to spit out the actual data.
        Parameters:
        input - The input image, a multidimensional float or double array.
        td - A descriptor of the current tile.
        tileIndex - The tileIndex which is used to get the appropriate dither values.
        Returns:
        The byte data representing the integerized tile.

      • fill

        public void fill(byte[] tileData,
        Object data,
        TileDescriptor td)
        Restore a tile of the original data using the input byte array as input. The method calls recurseIn to descend to the bottom level of the array which calls the input method when it reaches the bottom level of the array to actually read and convert the data values.
        Parameters:
        tileStream - The stream of uncompressed bytes from the tile.
        tileData - The data array to be filled.
        td - The corners and size of the tile.
        tileIndex - The index of the tile.
